meanings.definition: A feeling of nervousness or unease.
meanings.sent1: The dark alley gave me the willies.
meanings.sent2: Being alone in a spooky house always gives me the willies.
meanings.sent3: The creepy clown costume gave the children the willies.
meanings.sent4: The eerie silence of the abandoned house sent shivers of willies down my spine.
meanings.sent5: The strange noise in the attic filled me with the willies.

meanings.definition: A state of fear or anxiety.
meanings.sent1: The horror movie filled me with the willies.
meanings.sent2: Walking through the haunted forest gave me the willies.
meanings.sent3: The thought of failing the test gave me the willies.
meanings.sent4: The looming deadline for the project sent the willies through my body.
meanings.sent5: The growling sound in the dark alleyway put me in a state of willies.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel nervous or scared.
meanings.sent1: The sudden noise willies the cat.
meanings.sent2: The ghost stories willies the kids before bedtime.
meanings.sent3: The prankster loves to willies his friends with fake spiders.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected jump scare in the movie willies the audience.
meanings.sent5: The haunted house always manages to willies unsuspecting visitors.
